Do not block camera preview drawing on detection
Proportion of the head width to the image width, and the valid value range is [0.0, 1.0]
Minimum face size must be a float value and in the range [0.0, 1.0]
If enabled, GPU will be used as long as it is available, stable and returns correct results. In this case, the detector will not check if GPU is really faster than CPU.

Classify squat and pushup poses. Count reps in streaming mode. To get the best classification results based on the current sample data, face the camera side way and make sure your full body is in the frame.

Warrior2:

Starting Position:
Step 1. Stand in the Mountain Pose.
Step 2. Take a big step with your right foot to the right side and turn your right foot out.
Step 3. Extend your arms to the sides and gaze over your right hand.

Finishing Position:
Step 1. Look back at the camera.
Step 2. Lower your arms and step your right foot back to the Mountain Pose.

Benefits:
Strengthens the entire body, strengthens the core, improves hip flexibility, tones the arms, improves focus.

Proper Alignment:
1. Keep your chin tucked and gaze over your right hand.
2. Keep your torso perpendicular to the floor.
3. Extend your arms to the sides with your palms facing down.
4. (Right) thigh should be parallel to the floor.
5. Face the camera and bend your (right) knee over the (right) ankle at about 90-degree angle.
6. Make sure your knee does not extend past your toes.
7. Keep your left leg straight and turn it out about 45 degrees from the center of your body.
8. Face the camera and turn your left toes toward the front.
9. Keep your right toes pointing in the same direction as your right knee.
10. Your feet should be about a leg's length apart, and the angle between your left and right foot should be about 90 degrees.

Plank:

Starting position: step1. Begin in a four-legged kneeling position.
step2. Straighten both legs backward, forming a diagonal line with the shoulders, hips, and ankles.
step3. Look diagonally forward.

Finishing position: step1. Bring the gaze back.
step2. Lower both knees to the ground, returning to the four-legged kneeling position.

Benefits:
Strengthens the core muscles, improves body balance, and corrects posture.

Correct posture:
1. Keep the arms perpendicular to the ground.
2. The shoulders and wrists should be in a straight line.
3. The body forms a diagonal line from the neck, back, hips, knees, to the ankles, with an angle of about 45 degrees to the ground.
4. Keep the shoulders in a straight line, avoiding chicken wings (shoulder shrugs).
5. Keep the hips in a straight line, avoiding lifting or dropping the hips.
6. The knees should maintain a 180-degree angle.
7. Keep the neck in a straight line, avoiding lifting or lowering the head.

Goddess:

Starting position:
step1. Stand in a mountain pose.
step2. Take a big step to the right with your right foot and squat down with both feet parallel to the ground.
step3. Lift both hands straight up to shoulder level, palms facing forward.

Ending position:
step1. Lower your hands and bring your right foot back to return to the mountain pose.

Benefits:
Improves circulation in the lower body, reduces swelling, strengthens the muscles and ankles of the legs, exercises the muscles of the waist and abdomen, and promotes flexibility in the knee joints.

Proper posture:
1. Keep your body perpendicular to the ground.
2. Look straight ahead with your chin tucked in.
3. Bend your elbows and keep your upper arms parallel to the ground.
4. Form a 90-degree angle between your hands and upper arms, with your fingers pointing toward the ceiling and your palms facing the camera.
5. Keep your thighs parallel to the ground.
6. Keep your calves at a 90-degree angle to your thighs.
7. Do not let your knees extend beyond your toes.
8. Keep your feet shoulder-width apart.
9. Point your toes to the left and right.

Chair:

Starting Position:
Step 1. Stand with your feet together in a mountain pose.
Step 2. Bend your knees slightly and lean your upper body back. Your knees should not go beyond your toes.
Step 3. Bring your hands together and lift them up diagonally.

Finishing Position:
Step 1. Lower your hands and straighten your legs to return to the mountain pose.

Benefits:
Stabilizes the pelvis, improves stiff back, and sculpts the buttocks.

Correct Form:
1. Raise your arms diagonally.
2. Lean your upper body forward, and the angle between your thighs and your torso should be between 45 and 90 degrees.
3. Keep your thighs and feet close together.
4. Your knees should not extend beyond your toes.
5. Your thighs and calves should form an approximately 90-degree angle.

DownDog:

Starting Position:
step1. Start on all fours.
step2. Lift knees off the floor, curl toes under, and straighten legs.
step3. Press hips up and back.

Ending Position:
step1. Lower knees to the floor to return to all fours.

Benefits:
Stretches the hamstrings, lengthens the spine, regulates breath, increases bone density, strengthens chest muscles.

Proper Alignment:
1. Arms are straight and shoulder-width apart.
2. Elbows, neck, shoulders, and hips are in a straight line.
3. Back remains flat.
4. Hips, knees, and heels are in a straight line.
5. Knees are straight.
6. Heels are grounded.

Four Limbed Staff:

Starting Position:
step1. Start in a four-legged kneeling position.
step2. Walk your hands forward and lift your knees off the ground.
step3. Lower your elbows and shoulders.

Ending Position:
step1. Lower your knees back to the ground.
step2. Lower yourself down to the ground and return to the starting position.

Benefits:
Strengthens and tones your arms, legs, and core muscles while improving stability.

Proper Form:
1. Your neck, back, hips, knees, and heels should form a straight line and be parallel to the ground.
2. Your upper arms should be at a 90-degree angle to your forearms.
3. Your forearms and palms should be at a 90-degree angle.
4. Your upper arms should be parallel to the ground.
5. Your elbows should be tucked in close to your sides, and your ribs should be drawn in.
6. Your shoulders should be level with your elbows.
7. Your back should be flat.
8. Your knees should be straight.

Boat:

Starting Position:
step1. Sit with your legs relaxed and extended forward.
step2. Raise your legs diagonally upward while keeping your back straight.
step3. Extend your arms forward with your gaze fixed on your toes.
Ending Position:
step1. Lower your arms and return your legs to the starting position.

Benefits:
Regulates liver, gallbladder, and spleen function, strengthens abdominal muscles, legs, and back, and strengthens core muscles.

Correct Posture:
1. Keep your back straight.
2. The upper body is angled about 30 degrees from the floor.
3. The lower body is angled about 30 degrees from the floor.
4. Keep your knees straight.
5. Extend your arms straight with your palms facing each other.

Rejuvenation:

Starting steps:
step1. Lie down and relax the whole body.
step2. Lift both feet straight up, toes pointing toward the ceiling, and hook toes back.

Ending steps:
step1. Put your feet back on the floor.

Advantages:
Increase flexibility, relax muscles, reduce stress and anxiety.

Standard posture:
1. Keep your knees straight.
2. Lift both feet up vertically to the floor.

Star:

Starting Position:
step1. Stand in mountain pose.
step2. Take a big step to the right with your right foot, toes pointing diagonally forward.
step3. Extend your arms sideways and gaze straight ahead.

Ending Position:
step1. Bring your hands and feet back to mountain pose.

Benefits:
Improves posture, reduces back and shoulder pain, improves blood circulation and breathing, stretches the body.

Proper Alignment:
1. Extend your arms sideways with palms facing down.
2. Tuck your chin in and look straight ahead.
3. Keep your body vertical to the floor.
4. Keep your knees straight.
5. Spread your feet apart, shoulder-width distance.
6. Point your toes toward the camera.

Tree:

Starting Position:
step1. Stand in mountain pose.
step2. Turn your right foot 90 degrees to the right and place the sole of your foot on the inner thigh of your left leg.
step3. Raise your arms straight up and join your palms together.

Ending Position:
step1. Bring your right foot back to the ground, toes pointing forward.
step2. Lower your arms back to mountain pose.

Benefits:
Improves balance, increases blood circulation, strengthens knee joints and relaxes hip joints, increases leg stability.

Proper Alignment:
1. Tuck your chin in and look straight ahead.
2. Keep your body vertical to the floor.
3. Raise your arms straight up, parallel to each other, with palms facing each other.
4. Keep your left hip in a straight line.
5. Keep your left knee straight.
6. Place your right foot sole on the inner thigh of your left leg, above the left knee.
7. Turn your right knee 90 degrees to the right.
List already exists. Please rename it.
Accuracy in the last 8 training sessions
